solution_line_template: If on the return journey to its home, the alligator took {return_journey_extra_hours} more hours than it took to travel to the Nile Delta, Paul took {paul_initial_journey_hours}+{return_journey_extra_hours}=<<{paul_initial_journey_hours}+{return_journey_extra_hours}={paul_return_journey_hours}>>{paul_return_journey_hours} hours to travel back to its home.

The total time Paul took to travel from its home to the Nile Delta and back is {paul_return_journey_hours}+{paul_initial_journey_hours}=<<{paul_return_journey_hours}+{paul_initial_journey_hours}={paul_total_journey_time}>>{paul_total_journey_time}

On his return journey, Paul traveled with six other alligators, and since each alligator traveled for {paul_return_journey_hours} hours up the Nile to their home, they took a total of {num_other_alligators}*{paul_return_journey_hours}=<<{num_other_alligators}*{paul_return_journey_hours}={other_alligators_total_time}>>{other_alligators_total_time} hours to do so.

Together with Paul, all the alligators took {paul_total_journey_time}+{other_alligators_total_time}=<<{paul_total_journey_time}+{other_alligators_total_time}={combined_alligator_time}>>{combined_alligator_time} hours traveling between Nile Delta and up the Nile.
